column4: i'm having trouble getting daemontools to work on hardy, whether i follow straight djb instructions from source, or use the packages via a howto which says to point at debian etch for builder debs.. any pointers?
the source install seems to work but init never starts svscan
and what is svscan - a service?
'what is' ?
oh, sorry, svscan is a process controller
well, does /etc/init.d/*svscan* exist?
it doesn't run that way, it appends to /etc/inittab

well, you have a problem as ubuntu uses upstart instead of sysvinit now -- maybe you can write a wrapper around svscan to test whether it is running at regular intervals, if it isn't start it up again - to achieve the same effect
that's not the same effect, that's not how svscan works.  it's a smaller program than bash, and designed to be reliable..
what does svscan do?
well, you don't have to get svscan to wait for a script to start it -- just use the script as a failsafe for when svscan fails
mono-1.0-devel
courtesy packages.ubuntu.com
thanks, i'll fish for myself next time ;)

only for installed packages, yeah?
